org.jacktheclipper.frontend.service

Class FeedService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jacktheclipper.frontend.service.FeedService

  • @Service
public class FeedService
extends java.lang.Object
    This class bundles up all requests to the backend which involve Feeds. This includes @ UserSettingss.

    • Method Detail

      • getSettingsForUser

        public UserSettings getSettingsForUser(java.util.UUID userId)
                                throws BackendException
        Returns the settings (and within his feeds) of the given user
        Parameters:
        userId - The user requesting the settings
        Returns:
        The UserSettings for the given user or null, if the user was not found
        Throws:
        BackendException - If no userSettings could be found for the supplied

      • getUserInformation

        public ExtendedUser getUserInformation(java.util.UUID requestingUserId,
                                       java.util.UUID userId)
                                throws BackendException
        Gets all necessary information on a user that is needed to manage him. In comparison this also gets all the OrganizationalUnits a user belongs to.
        Parameters:
        requestingUserId - The id of the user wanting to know the information
        userId - The id of the user whose information is requested
        Returns:
        The information of the user as an ExtendedUser.
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the REST-call failed or returned an empty body.

      • getUserFeedsNoArticles

        public java.util.List<Feed> getUserFeedsNoArticles(java.util.UUID userId)
        Gets all the feeds a user has
        Parameters:
        userId - The user which feeds should be looked up
        Returns:
        A list of the user's feeds

      • addFeed

        public void addFeed(java.util.UUID settingsId,
                    Feed feed)
             throws BackendException
        Adds the given feed to the supplied settings
        Parameters:
        settingsId - The id of the settings the feed should be added to
        feed - The feed that should be added
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the addition of the feed failed

      • updateFeed

        public void updateFeed(Feed feed,
                       java.util.UUID settingsId)
                throws BackendException
        Modifies a feed.
        Parameters:
        feed - The feed which should be updated
        settingsId - The id of the settings to which the feed should be added
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the feed could not be updated

      • deleteFeed

        public void deleteFeed(java.util.UUID feedId)
                throws BackendException
        Deletes the feed with the given id
        Parameters:
        feedId - The id of the feed that should be deleted
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the feed could not be deleted

      • getArticle

        public Article getArticle(java.util.UUID articleId,
                          java.util.UUID userId)
                   throws BackendException
        Gets the specified article
        Parameters:
        articleId - The id of the requested article
        userId - The id of the user requesting the article so that the backend can verify if he has access to it
        Returns:
        The article matching the id or null if any error is encountered
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the article cannot be found

      • updateNotificationSettings

        public void updateNotificationSettings(int checkInterval,
                                       java.util.UUID settingsId,
                                       NotificationSetting notificationSetting,
                                       int articlesPerPage)
                                throws BackendException
        Updates a user's notification settings
        Parameters:
        checkInterval - The time between notifications. This cannot be negative
        settingsId - The id of the settings to update
        notificationSetting - How the notification should be delivered
        articlesPerPage - How many articles the user wants to see on a feed page
        Throws:
        BackendException - If the userSettings could not be updated

      • getSpecificFeed

        public java.util.List<ShortArticle> getSpecificFeed(java.util.UUID userId,
                                                    java.util.UUID feedId,
                                                    java.lang.Integer page,
                                                    java.lang.Boolean showArchived)
        Gets the shortArticles belonging to the requested feed
        Parameters:
        userId - The user wishing to see his feed
        feedId - The feed that the user requested
        page - The index of the page to get. If null is passed this defaults to 0
        showArchived - Whether to show all indexed articles of this feed or only the recent ones. Defaults to false which means only the recent articles are shown
        Returns:
        A list of articles matching the criteria of the feeds filters
